name: HighsRbTree
brief:
Array-based Red-Black tree with CRTP interface

Self-balancing BST using indices instead of pointers for cache efficiency.

**CRTP Pattern:**
- RbTreeTraits<Impl>: Define KeyType and LinkType
- Impl::getRbTreeLinks(): Return reference to RbTreeLinks
- Impl::getKey(): Return comparable key value

**RbTreeLinks Structure:**
- child[2]: Left/right child indices
- parentAndColor: Parent packed with color bit (saves storage)
- Works with both integer and pointer LinkTypes

**Tree Operations:**
- link(): Insert node, rebalance via red-black rotations
- unlink(): Remove node with transplant and fixup
- find(): Search returning (node, exact_match) pair
- first()/last(): Minimum/maximum in subtree
- successor()/predecessor(): In-order traversal

**CacheMinRbTree Variant:**
- Maintains cached pointer to minimum element
- O(1) access to first() for priority queue usage

**Usage in HiGHS:**
- HighsNodeQueue: Priority queue for B&B nodes by bound
- Efficient ordered containers with O(log n) operations
